p: While age-based targeting greatly reduces the number of deaths over the long-term, it comes at the cost of slightly more AIDS deaths relative to CD4-based targeting in the years immediately following the TasP campaign (as illustrated in Fig 2I). This tradeoff can be quantified using time-discounted AIDS deaths; i.e., a measure of AIDS deaths that gives less weight to future deaths than current deaths. In S6 Fig, we show that, for discount rates between 0 and 7% per year, age-based targeting reduces time-discounted AIDS deaths compared to the other strategies in Fig 3.
